Inputs Required: Rule#297 - Detecting unusual login patterns with behavior analytics rule
Instructions: This alert is triggred when one or more successful or failed authentication attempts, or session initiations, that significantly deviate from the user’s established behavioral baseline — including unusual geolocation, IP address, device, time of access, or user agent
Gather details of all users - (By adding sheet to this excel)
Cross-check usernames with VIP list from Arcutis

Inputs Required: Run the KQL query then, Check for IP Address, UserName, Location & Time and User agent
Input Details: Observed the events , checked the sign in logs for the user - Vchittepu@arcutis.com, all failed logis were seen , the location is US and the Ip is clean in virus total, (50.226.4.130 ) hence closing as FP.
Instructions:
Review login event details (user account, IP address, time,  Geo location & User agent)
Analyze audit and signin logs to identify successful and failed attempts for last 7 days & device history.

Check IP reputation using VirusTotal
If bad score, take a screenshot for documentation
Based on the investigation, if you still find it suspicious, then get confirmation from the user. If user confirms then close it as: False Positive
If user says they are not aware about the acitivty then treat it as : True Positive

Inputs Required: Inform to IT Team to Reset the account, Revoke the MFA tokens, Temporary disable the account
Instructions: Reach out to the Network/EDR teams to block the detected suspicious IP, Inform user to reset password, maintain complex password and enable MFA.
After all the investigation document the steps taken, findings, and any remediation actions required
